sense.def:
To state something
pomeni nekaj reči ali napisati, predvsem na uraden način.

seg.quote: The government have stated quite categorically that we're going to see changes.
The police were called, but the man refused to state his business.
He stated, ‘I have passed the stage where such things matter.’

sense.def:
The state of someone or something
se nanaša na to, kakšen je nekdo ali nekaj ali kaj doživlja.

seg.quote: They are very concerned about the state of the churchyard.
She seemed in a very queer and nervous state.
People wandered about in a state of shock.

sense.def:
Dežele ali večja območja dežel pogosto imenujemo
states
.

seg.quote: The Latin American states maintained their independence.
Haryana and Punjab were the fastest-developing states in India.

sense.def:
Vlado neke države lahko imenujemo
the state
.

seg.quote: ...the conflict between the freedom of the individual and the security of the state.

sense.def:
Pri slovesni priložnosti, ki je
state
, sodeluje državni voditelj.

seg.quote: ...the state visit of a European monarch.

sense.def:
To be in a state
pomeni počutiti se vznemirjenega in živčnega;

seg.quote: He used to get into an awful state as exams approached.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ni
in a fit state to do something
, je preveč vznemirjen ali bolan, da bi nekaj storil.

seg.quote: The parent is in no fit state to help the children.
